definition:
Ponds are generally defined as small (1 m<sup>2</sup> to ∼50,000 m<sup>2</sup>), shallow, standing water bodies that can either permanently or temporarily collect freshwater. 

</end_of_turn>

Ponds are small standing waters varying in size from 1 m<sup>2</sup> to about 2-5 ha in area and may be permanent or seasonal, man-made or naturally created. 

</end_of_turn>

The context defines **ponds** as: “small lentic ecosystems that permanently or temporarily hold water [1]. They are shallow and their size ranges from a few square metres to several hectares.”

It also defines **lakes** as constituting “a small percentage of the total number of lakes” but does not provide a specific definition beyond that.
